results.title: The Fight in Malaya
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Modern Age”.
A survey of the geographical, political, social, racial, religious and military influences which make up modern Malaya, shown in relation to communist guerilla warfare on the peninsula. Explains the conflicting aims and ideas of the four distinct racial groups: Malay, Chinese, Indian and European.

results.title: The Fight game
results.creator_credit: Forum Films and March of Time, Inc.
results.brief_description: A survey of boxing from the days when the rules were first formalised, to the present use of boxing by groups working wiht boys to give them healthful recreation and to channel their energies away from socially destructive practices. Includes scenes of Gane, Nelson, Dempsey, Tunney and Louis. The film closes with an examination of racketeering and other ills afflicting the sport and their possible cure.

results.brief_description: This short animated film describes briefly the aims and work of the World Health Organisation: to fight disease and help give to every human being their fundamental right to the highest attainable standard of health.

results.title: The Fifties
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Life goes to the movies”.
Examines the impact of television and the courts’ decisions to separate film exhibition from production and distribution in Hollywood’s film industry during the period up to the seventies. Shows a series of film clips exemplifying the 1950’s preoccupation with romantic love themes. Suitable for Upper Secondary School Students.

results.title: The Field mouse
results.creator_credit: Steve Helling and Scandinavian Videocassette Group
results.brief_description: The life cycle, habits and characteristics of the field mouse are shown in the context of its ecosystem. Highlights factors such as food availability, predators, population levels and adaptive behaviour. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Fibre web
results.creator_credit: Alan Harper, Campbell Harper Films and Henry Cooper
results.brief_description: Shows the manufacture of high-quality paper in Scotland, and its uses throughout the world. Today, the uses of paper extend beyond visible applications for books, or maps, labels, or cheques, to become the insulators for telephone cables, giant transformers or computers. Narrated by Kenneth Horne.

results.title: The Fenlands
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Regional Geography”.
The Fenlands situated in Eastern England are one of the flattest regions of Britain. The Fenland landscape is almost wholly manmade, being the result of draining the land, to make it available for agriculture. The danger of flooding is ever present, and in 1947 a disastrous flood occurred. In an attempt to overcome the problem, an extensive sluice system has been devised.
